intro: Galactites × rigualii, commonly known as the hybrid milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, often pink or purple flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that contains toxic compounds, which serve as a defense mechanism against herbivores. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal dunes or along the edges of forests. Galactites × rigualii plays an important role in supporting local ecosystems, particularly for certain species of butterflies and birds.
